page.title: 02NYLAND HILL
page.content: {NYLAND HILL}IS IN THE SOUTHERN END OF OUR {"D BLOCK"},SO WE CLIMBED THE HILL TO SEE OUR WHOLE AREA FROM THE TOP.THE HILL IS ONLY{252 FEET HIGH},BUT IT IS VERY STEEP,SO IT SEEMED MUCH HIGHER WHEN WE CLIMBED IT,AND THE VIEW FROM THE TOP WAS BEAUTIFUL.WE COULD SEE THAT THE LAND WAS VERY FLAT OVER THE MOORS WHICH COVERS MOST OF THE AREA. THE FARMERS WERE MAKING SILAGE IN LOTS OF THE FIELDS. TO THE NORTH OF { {DRAYCOTT}THE GROUND BEGAN TO RISE TO THE {MENDIPS,}ON TOP OF THE HILLS WE COULD SEE WOODS AND ROCKY CRAGGS.WE SAW ALL THE {STRAWBERRY FIELDS}AROUND DRAYCOTT, AND EACH SIDE OF THE ROAD TO CHEDDAR.THROUGH BINOCULARS WE COULD RECOGNISE SOME OF THE BUILDINGS IN DRAYCOTT, INCLUDING OUR SCHOOL.
